label: AB3C5D10E2_hP21_164_a_bc_de_2di_d-001
title: Averievite [(CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(PO$_{4}$)$_{2}$] Structure
comments:
Averievite is characterized by the presence of a backbone composed of Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$ clusters and either VO$_{4}$ or PO$_{4}$ tetrahedra. The exact structure depends on atoms added to the backbone.  We have included several averievite structures in the Encyclopedia: \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A5B10C2_mP68_14_5e_10e_2e-001}{Stoiberite}, Cu$_{5}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A18B15C10D2_hP45_164_ij_abcdei_2di_d-001}{(ClCu)$_{2}$Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C10D2_hP21_143_2a_2abcd_2b2c2d_bc-001}{Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$$\cdot$CuCl$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C5D10E2_hP21_164_a_bc_de_2di_d-001}{(CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(PO$_{4}$)$_{2}$} (this structure), \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C5D10E2_mP40_14_a_e_c2e_5e_e-001}{Monoclinic (CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C10D20E4_hP86_147_ae_c2g_d3g_2d6g_dg-001}{Trigonal (CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB5C2D10E2_mC80_15_e_e2f_f_5f_f-001}{(KBr)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 See (Starov, 1997), (Botana, 2018), and (Kornyakov, 2021) for more information. 
 In the current structure the Cs I (1b) Wyckoff position is occupied 60\% of the time, while the Cs II (2c) Wyckoff position is occupied 20\% of the time. This presumably means that only one of the three sites, (0 0 0), (0, 0, z$_{3}$) or (0, 0, -z$_{3}$) is occupied in any unit cell.  The distance between the (1b) and (2c) sites is 0.43{\AA}, so it may be easier to think of this as one atom with a very large atomic displacement along the z-axis. 
 (Botana, 2018) describe a similar structure for the high-temperature (400K) form of (CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$.  In that structure the Cs (1b) site is unoccupied and the Cs (2c) site is half-filled.
